data.question: When was the research article on the transformation of polynuclear gold(I)-sulfido complexes published?
What is the main focus of the research article by Liang-Liang Yan and colleagues?
data.answer: The main focus is on the substituent-mediated transformation from pentagold(I) to octadecagold(I) complexes.

data.question: What method was used to monitor the transformation process of gold(I)-sulfido complexes?
data.answer: NMR spectroscopy in solution state

data.question: True or False: The transformation of polynuclear gold(I)-sulfido complexes was observed without the use of NMR spectroscopy.
data.answer: False

data.question: What effect do electron-withdrawing substituents have on the transformation of gold(I)-sulfido complexes?
data.answer: They lead to structural reorganization of the clusters to maximize Au···Au interactions.

data.question: True or False: The transformation from pentagold(I) to octadecagold(I) complexes results in complexes with the same photophysical properties.
data.answer: False

data.question: What is the role of H2S in the transformation process of gold(I)-sulfido complexes?
data.answer: H2S is necessary for the transformation, providing the sulfur source.

data.question: True or False: The transformation of gold(I)-sulfido complexes is independent of the electronic nature of the substituent on the phosphine ligand.
data.answer: False

data.question: What structural feature is crucial for the formation of octadecagold(I) complexes from pentagold(I) complexes?
data.answer: The electron-withdrawing substituents such as –F and –CN

data.question: How were the structures of the polynuclear gold(I)-sulfido complexes characterized?
data.answer: By NMR, HR-ESI-MS, and electronic absorption and emission spectroscopies

data.question: True or False: The transformation from pentagold(I) to octadecagold(I) complexes was reversible.
data.answer: False

data.question: What was the yield of [LF-Au5]Cl as white crystals?
data.answer: 85 mg (84% based on the Au content)

data.question: What is the significance of the Au···Au distances in the transformation of gold(I)-sulfido complexes?
data.answer: The Au···Au distances indicate aurophilic interactions which are crucial for the structural reorganization of the clusters.

data.question: True or False: The transformation of gold(I)-sulfido complexes was solely dependent on the presence of H2S.
data.answer: False

data.question: What computational method was used to study the effect of substituent groups on the stabilities of the gold(I) clusters?
data.answer: Density functional theory (DFT) with the hybrid Perdew, Burke, and Ernzerhof (PBE0) functional

data.question: True or False: The transformation process of gold(I)-sulfido complexes was monitored using X-ray crystallography.
data.answer: False

data.question: What was the role of the rigid diphosphine ligands in the synthesis of polynuclear gold(I)-sulfido complexes?
data.answer: The rigid diphosphine ligands with well-defined P–P bite distances were used to optimize P–P bite distances for the controlled synthesis of various polynuclear complex structures.

data.question: True or False: The transformation from pentagold(I) to octadecagold(I) complexes was achieved without the use of chlorogold(I) precursors.
data.answer: False

data.question: What was the effect of the transformation from Au5 to Au18 on the UV–vis absorption spectra?
data.answer: The transformation brought about a dramatic red shift in the UV–vis absorption spectra.

data.question: True or False: The luminescent properties of the pentanuclear and octadecanuclear gold(I)-sulfido clusters were identical in both solution and solid state.
data.answer: False
